For all other password-based authentication, the information systems follow the direction in the applicable baseline configurations per CM-6, or if more stringent, the information system, for password-based authentication: a. Prohibits the use of dictionary names or words; b. Meets or exceeds enforcement of the following minimum password requirements: - MinimumPasswordAge = one (1) day; - MaximumPasswordAge = sixty (60) days; - MinimumPasswordLength = Minimum length of eight (8) characters for regular user passwords, and minimum length of fifteen (15) characters for administrators or privileged user passwords; - PasswordComplexity = minimum (three (3) for High or one (1) for Moderate or Low) character(s) from the four (4) character categories (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, special characters; and - PasswordHistorySize = twelve (12) passwords for High or six (6) passwords for Moderate or Low systems. c. The minimum length (MinimumPasswordLength) for administrators or privileged users is fifteen (15) characters;d. If the operating environment enforces a minimum of number of changed characters when new passwords are created, set the value at twelve (12) for High and six (6) for Moderate or Low systems; e. Stores and transmits only encrypted representations of passwords; and f. Allows the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Identification and Authentication">9587f9fcdb211010280df36f2996193a</control_family> <control_name>Password-Based Authentication</control_name> <control_number>IA-05(01)</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory Enhancement</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>IA-05</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Systems defined as CSPs:  High, Moderate & Low:  CSP.1 - CSPs must implement this Standard (IA-5(1) CSP.1) as a replacement for the above Control Enhancement (IA-5(1)). The information system, f</implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010998</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:25</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>IA-6</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>This control enhancement applies to single-factor authentication of individuals using passwords as individual or group authenticators, and in a similar manner, when passwords are part of multifactor authenticators. This control enhancement does not apply when passwords are used to unlock hardware authenticators (e.g., PIV cards). The implementation of such password mechanisms may not meet all the requirements in the control enhancement. Encrypted representations of passwords include, for example, encrypted versions of passwords and one-way cryptographic hashes of passwords. The number of changed characters refers to the number of changes required with respect to the total number of positions in the current password.
